content: This article is about the Climate Action Plan of Sembcorp, a company that manages its climate-related risks and opportunities. The company follows the recommendations of the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) and conducts risk-based scenario analysis in its investment decisions. The Climate Change Working Committee, chaired by the executive vice president, is responsible for the development of plans, processes, and reports addressing the company's climate risks and opportunities. The committee meets at least twice a year and provides updates to other committees such as the Enterprise Risk Committee and the Sustainability Steering Committee. The Enterprise Risk Committee monitors and reviews risk management performance and appropriateness of risk mitigation measures, and reports to the board's Risk Committee on a quarterly basis to monitor group-wide risks.
